div.head: KHEDIVIAL MAIL LINE.
div.p: Express Steamers leave Alexandria every Wednesday at 4 p.m. for PIRAEUS, SMYRNA, MITYLENE, and CONSTANTINOPLE, in connection with Orient Express train-de-luxe for Vienna, Paris, and London.

Fast steamers leave Alexandria every Saturday at 4 p.m., and Port Said every Sunday at 4 p.m., for JAFFA (for Jerusalem), CAIFFA (for Nazareth), BEYROUT (for Damascus), TRIPOLI, ALEXANDRETTA, MESSINA, continuing in alternate weeks to LARNACA and LIMASSOL (Cyprus).

Steamers leave Suez fortnightly on Wednesday at 6 p.m. for JEDDAH, SUAKIN, MASSOWAH, HODBIDAH, and ADEN ; and in the intervening weeks for PORT SUDAN and SUAKIN direct. Calls will be made at TOR (for Mount Sinai) as required.
N.B.—Deck chairs provided for the use of passengers, excellent cuisine and table wine free.
Steamer plans may be seen and passages booked at the Company's Agencies at Alexandria, Cairo, Port Said, and Suez, or at THOS. COOK & SON or other Tourist Agency.

div.head: Service Maritime Roumain
div.p: 16 Rue Sesostris 16

Par suite de la quarantaine de 48 houres imposée par la Turquie aux provenances d'Egypte les paquebots-poste du Service Maritime Roumain quitteront Alexandrie chaque quinzaine le Mercredi à 4 heures de l'après midi. Au cas où cette quarantaine serait réduite à 24 heures seulement les départs auront lieu le Jeudi à 4 p.m.
Alexandrie, le 25 Juin 1907.

div.head: BOVRIL
div.p: Qu'est ce que c'est BOVRIL?
BOVRIL est le produit garanti du meilleur bétail qui existe.
C'est un repas à la minute qui protège contre les intempéries.
"BOVRIL" et "Bonne Cuisine" sont deux mots qui disent la même chose.

BOVRIL répond a une nécessité; il est non seulement une boisson delicieuse et saine, mais il est encore indispensable pour préparer instantanement des soupes et sauces appétisantes. Bovril n'a pas de rival pour corser les plats les plus récherches.
BOVRIL répare l'organisme fatigué.

div.head: BULLETIN DE LA BOURSE
div.p: (Aujour@ hui @ 11h, 1/2 am).

Le marché. n'a pas présenté ce matin la méme animation que vendredi dernier et la cote a été moins soutenue pour les valeurs dirigeantes, mais la tendance, s'il faut en croire la généralité des intéressés, -demeure ferme avec unedemande de bon augure pour l'avenir. Il y a des acheteurs, dit-on, et en général ils doivent payer un prix supérieur & celui coté. Bref, les acheteurs affluent, tandis que les ven- deurs se sont éclipsés. Nous avons déjA signalé trop de fois les raisons qui déterminent ces revirements haussiers chaque fin de mois pour y revenir.

Les affaires ont porté spécialement sur Agricole, qui a cloturé offerte 4 7 7/8 et sur la National Bank qui a perdu 1/4 de livre & 19 3/16. La Daira Sanieh a, an contraire, gagné 1/4 de livre 4 14 1/8 et. PObligation Crédit Foncier 5 fr. l'ancienne 4 306 et 8 fr. 50 la nouvelle 4 264 1/2. La Delta Light a été inscrite A 9 1/2 ex coupon.

En ce qui concerne |'Obligation Crédit Fon- cier, la hausse ininterrompue dont ce titre bénéficie depuis quelques jours serait occa} sionnée, sil faut en croire un bruit acerédité en bourse, & un découvert qu'on cherche a égorger. Si ce bruit est fondé, il est probable que le recul,constaté récemment sera totale- ment regagné, et au-deld.

Une autre valeur qui progresse de fagon inattendue, aprés de longs mois de baisse et de marasme, c'est la Building Lands dont le prix remonte d'un coup de 2 1/16 & 2 7/16-1/2. La raison qu'on allégue pour cette reprisa soudaine est le rachat par la société elle-méme de ses titres dépréciés, |
En hausse encore les Tramways d'Alexan- drie de 136 4 137 les Privilégiées et de 280 i 282 les Dividendes, |'Alexandria Water de 10 5/8 & 10 3/4, la Land Bank de 6 13/16 a 7 1/16.

Parmiles petites valeurs la Delta Land, trés soutenue, s'avance de 1 7/16 4 1 1/2, Ordinary Khedivial Mail de 20/9 4 21, PAnglo-Egyptian Allotment de 1 7/8 4 2 l'action et de 50 4 60 P.T. la part de fondateur, les Cotton Ginners de 11/4 41 5/16, et la Levico de 1/4 a 5/16. Lia part de fondateur de cette dernitre s'inscrit 4 4 livres. On achéte la fondateur Unitedal 3/4.
En revanche, les Nungovich Hotels revien- nent de 14 4 13, l'action nouvelle Comptoir de 25/164 21/4, Union Fonciére de 4 1/2 a 4 7/16, le Crédit Franco-Egyptien de 4 1/16 a 4.
Les Estates sont trés sontenus A 1/2-9/16. La Cassa di Sconto reprend: de 25 & 26.
Le reste de la cote demeure sans changement.

Ainsi que nous l'avons déja dit au début de ce bulletin, bien que l'ensemble dela cote ne soit pas aussi satisfaisant que vendredi der- nier, l'impression générale est meilleure. Les acheteurs ne s'esquivent pas de facon aussi absolue que naguére et si pour certains titres, comme la National Bank, 'les transactions ne s'effectuent qu'au prix d'une réduction, pour d'autres, au contraire, les acquéreurs acceptent de payer un surplus.
Le tout est desavoirs'il nes'agit pas d'un simple découvert ou d'une réaction passa- gére, ou si p aIIHOEREON est appelde & ce consolider.

div.head:
HAUGUE CONFERENCE
ABOLITION OF CONTRABAND
DIVERGENCE OF OPINION

div.p: The Conference debated the British proposal regarding the abolition of contraband, which was opposed by France, Russia, United States, aid Germany, who urged the framing ofa list of contraband articles. Lord Reay express- ed surprise at the attitude of the United States, quoting American state documents showing that the United States, formerly urged the abolition of contraband. Lord Reay declared that it was impossible to separate absolute contraband from relative. General Porter, replying-to Lord Reay, said that he preferred the modern policy of President Roosevelt to the ancient and out-of-date poliey quoted by Lord Reay. ( Reuter)

div.head:
ROYAL IRISH CONSTABULARY
A MUTINOUS MEETING.

div.p: 500 men of the Royal Irish Constabulary at an excitéd meeting in the barrack square resolved to demand a _permanent increase in .pay of a shilling a day, an increase in pensions, and the right to discuss grievan- ces whenever they please. Crowds of cheer- ing towns people invaded the barracks and earried the ringleader on sheir shoul- ders to the Custom House where he harangued the crowd, amid the cheers of the populace, including the strikers, (Aeuter)

div.head:
RAISULI AND MACLEAN.
IMPERIAL TROOPS ACTIVE.

div.p: The Imperial troops have attacked the Pretender's position at Marchica and have been repulsed with heavy loss. (Reuter)
The Sultan's forces have arrived on the horders of the Khmass country where El Raisuli is detained. (Reuter)
The Snltan's forces have attacked the Kimass border villages. They have gained a complete victory, killing many people and burning and looting the villages. (Reuter)

div.head:
CHINESE ON THE RAND.
PROTEST AGAINST REPATRIATION.

div.p: The Chinese in a number of Rand Mines have petitioned against repatriation, pointing out that their contracts entitle them to a renewal of them. (Reuter)

div.head:
TWO DESTROYERS COLLIDE.
BOTH BADLY DAMAGED.

div.p: The destroyers "Waveney" and "Rother" have been damaged during the night, in a collision off Beachy Head, in connection with the mobilization manoenvres. (Reuter)

div.head:
FRENCH WINE QUESTION.
CHARGES OF INTIMIDATION.

div.p: The judiciary' authority is inquiring into the question of intimidation pursued by the viticultural committee with a view to effecting ty-morrow cantonal abstentions. (Havas)
Kent beat Leicesterhire by 21 runs. Notts beat Middlesex by 13 runs. Gloucestershire beat Warwickshire by 7 wickets. Surrey beat Hampshire by 5 wickets. (Reuter)

div.head:
HAUGUE CONFERENCE
ABOLITION OF CONTRABAND
DIVERGENCE OF OPINION

div.p: The Conference debated the British proposal regarding the abolition of contraband, which was opposed by France, Russia, United States, aid Germany, who urged the framing ofa list of contraband articles. Lord Reay express- ed surprise at the attitude of the United States, quoting American state documents showing that the United States, formerly urged the abolition of contraband. Lord Reay declared that it was impossible to separate absolute contraband from relative. General Porter, replying-to Lord Reay, said that he preferred the modern policy of President Roosevelt to the ancient and out-of-date poliey quoted by Lord Reay. ( Reuter)

div.head:
ROYAL IRISH CONSTABULARY
A MUTINOUS MEETING.

div.p: 500 men of the Royal Irish Constabulary at an excitéd meeting in the barrack square resolved to demand a _permanent increase in .pay of a shilling a day, an increase in pensions, and the right to discuss grievan- ces whenever they please. Crowds of cheer- ing towns people invaded the barracks and earried the ringleader on sheir shoul- ders to the Custom House where he harangued the crowd, amid the cheers of the populace, including the strikers, (Aeuter)

div.head:
RAISULI AND MACLEAN.
IMPERIAL TROOPS ACTIVE.

div.p: The Imperial troops have attacked the Pretender's position at Marchica and have been repulsed with heavy loss. (Reuter)
The Sultan's forces have arrived on the horders of the Khmass country where El Raisuli is detained. (Reuter)
The Snltan's forces have attacked the Kimass border villages. They have gained a complete victory, killing many people and burning and looting the villages. (Reuter)

div.head:
CHINESE ON THE RAND.
PROTEST AGAINST REPATRIATION.

div.p: The Chinese in a number of Rand Mines have petitioned against repatriation, pointing out that their contracts entitle them to a renewal of them. (Reuter)

div.head:
TWO DESTROYERS COLLIDE.
BOTH BADLY DAMAGED.

div.p: The destroyers "Waveney" and "Rother" have been damaged during the night, in a collision off Beachy Head, in connection with the mobilization manoenvres. (Reuter)

div.head:
FRENCH WINE QUESTION.
CHARGES OF INTIMIDATION.

div.p: The judiciary' authority is inquiring into the question of intimidation pursued by the viticultural committee with a view to effecting ty-morrow cantonal abstentions. (Havas)
Kent beat Leicesterhire by 21 runs. Notts beat Middlesex by 13 runs. Gloucestershire beat Warwickshire by 7 wickets. Surrey beat Hampshire by 5 wickets. (Reuter)
